ygData.subject: SK's in general (Is Brian even out there anymore?)
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve made the following observations thus far with my ShadowKnight: Dodge Capped at 25 Bash and Taunt capped at 30 parry & riposte capped at 35 Other then
ygData.messageBody:
I've made the following observations thus far with my ShadowKnight:

Dodge Capped at 25
Bash and Taunt capped at 30
parry & riposte capped at 35

Other then offense/defense and weapon skills (and magic), nothing is
improving. Only main things to look forward to are: New spells at 39, New
Skill at 40 (disarm) and new spells at 49. (I hear that weapon skills cap at
200 (ie level 39).

My question is this, since we're based on Warriors and Necros, why don't we
ever get Dual Wield? Some people say that we're the Anti-Paladin, but other
then HT, I see no other real opposites (and as to why paladains don't get it
either, I don't know). I understand why paladins don't get kick, but since
we're the evil opposite you figure we would.

But Warriors, Rangers, Rogues, Bards, Monks ALL get dual wield. Why don't
SK's? Now I'm curious. Paladins get awesome 1h slash weapons, and it would
be WAY too powerful for them to wield 2 weapons with a ghoul bane and some
other combo. But SK's never do get anything like that. So why can't we
have something nice to play with like that?

Princess Xaera
Dark Princess of Hate
